name: Similajau National Park
features: Coastal park with golden beaches, mangrove forests, and wildlife like crocodiles and dolphins. Ideal for hiking and beach picnics.
address: Approximately 30 km northeast of Bintulu town

name: Pantai Temasya Tanjung Batu
features: Popular beach with walkways, playgrounds, BBQ spots, and beautiful sunset views.

name: Tua Pek Kong Temple
features: One of the oldest Chinese temples in Bintulu with intricate carvings and statues. Culturally significant.
address: Near the old town of Bintulu

name: Taman Tumbina (Bintulu Botanical & Zoological Garden)
features: Zoo and botanical garden showcasing local flora and fauna. Family-friendly and educational.
address: Overlooking the South China Sea, Bintulu

name: Masjid Assyakirin (Bintulu Mosque)
features: Modern mosque with a waterfall feature and landscaped gardens. A place of worship and architectural interest.
address: In the heart of Bintulu town

name: Kuan Yin Tong Temple
features: Temple dedicated to the Goddess of Mercy, featuring a rock garden, dragon fence, and man-made waterfall.
address: Approximately 2 km from Bintulu city center on Jalan Sultan Iskandar

name: Pasar Tamu Bintulu
features: Traditional-style market under a Melanau cone roof. Great for local produce and cultural immersion.
address: Next to Pasar Utama, across the riverfront

name: Pulau Batu Mandi
features: Small scenic island popular for boat excursions and nature photography.

name: Taman Millenium
features: Public park with jogging tracks, green spaces, and playgrounds. Perfect for family outings.
